availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Wills (St. Louis, Missouri, bank president and director)

body.p: St. Louis, Missouri, bank president and director. Kentucky native. Married to E. H. Wills. Father of Betty Wills, John Wills, and Edward Wills. Bank President in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1860. Employed Annie Carey, Ellen McKay, and Jane Milton as servants in St. Louis in 1860. President of Mechanic's Bank in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1863. Director of Mutual Life Insurance Company in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Louis County, St. Louis Ward 6, p. 437.
“St. Louis Mutual Life Insurance Company,” Daily Missouri Republican, (St. Louis, Missouri), February 3, 1863.
